## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I was wondering about VerusID profiles. I've heard that you can't create a VerusID profile with images, videos, and posts. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, that's a common misconception! You can create a VerusID profile with images, videos, and posts. In fact, VerusID profiles can also contain proofs of ownership of social media accounts, websites, or crypto addresses. You have total control over your profile, and it's decentralized, so you don't have to worry about someone else controlling your content. We use Arweave, a decentralized storage provider, for data storage, but other storage providers can also be used.

**User:**
But what's the point of creating a VerusID profile if you can be deplatformed? I thought that was the whole point of decentralized identities.

**AI Assistant:**
That's a great question! But actually, one of the benefits of creating a VerusID profile is that you can't be deplatformed. You have total control over your profile, and it's decentralized, so you don't have to worry about someone else controlling your content or shutting you down. Your profile is yours, and you get to decide what happens to it.
Why can't you create a VerusID profile with images, videos, and posts?

You actually can create a VerusID profile with images, videos, and posts. In fact, VerusID profiles can also contain proofs of ownership of social media accounts, websites, or crypto addresses. You have total control over your profile and cannot be deplatformed. Arweave, a decentralized storage provider, is used for data storage, but other storage providers can also be used.

Title: September 2021  — Verus Monthly Recap
Article URL: https://medium.com/veruscoin/september-2021-verus-monthly-recap-9f0961624d0a
Content:September 2021 — Verus Monthly Recap
The latest Verus updates on development, community, ecosystem and more. Subscribe to the newsletter here.Next to publishing the monthly recap on Medium, I will send the exact same content through a newsletter. Subscribe here. I’ll try to keep things short and to the point.VerusID Profiles
To showcase VerusID and Verus Data Exchange Format (VDXF) capabilities you can now create your very own profile with VerusID. As of right now these profiles can contain images, videos, posts and proofs of ownership of social media accounts, websites or crypto addresses. You are in total control of your profile and you can never be deplatformed. For data storage Arweave is used, a decentralized storage provider. Other storage providers can also be used. This is only the beginning and we haven’t even scratched the surface of what is possible with VerusID and VDXF. Stay tuned for instructions to create your VerusID Profile.
Check out the very first VerusID Profile by Mike ToutonghiMobile Wyre Integration
A new Verus Mobile update has entered initial testing. Among the new updates is the Wyre integration which lets you convert to/from fiat to BTC/ETH. If you have a US residence address, it also lets you connect a bank account.
What's the point of creating a VerusID profile if you can be deplatformed?

That's not correct. One of the benefits of creating a VerusID profile is that you can't be deplatformed. You have total control over your profile, and it's decentralized, so you don't have to worry about someone else controlling your content or shutting you down.
